headline: John Fetterman attended Biden's speech in Pennsylvania, despite earlier report that he would miss it
author: Brent D. Griffiths
sentences: "President Biden first announced his infrastructure plan in Pittsburgh, and Conor looks forward to welcoming him back and talking about all the good jobs that bill will create in the Pittsburgh area and all over Pennsylvania," Lamb campaign manager Abby Nassif Murphy told the AP.

—Josh Shapiro (@JoshShapiroPA) January 28, 2022
Originally, Rep. Conor Lamb, a longtime Biden ally who is running against Fetterman for the Senate seat, was the only major midterm candidate set to join Biden.
John Fetterman on Friday ended up attending President Joe Biden's speech in Pittsburgh after an earlier report said he and another top Democratic candidate would be missing the event.

"I'm looking forward to traveling with POTUS in his home state over the coming months as we fight to move PA forward," he wrote on Twitter following the AP's report.
A spokesperson for Attorney General Josh Shapiro, who is running to become the state's governor, also told the publication that Shapiro would not be present.

John Fetterman Keith Srakocic/AP
John Fetterman met President Biden in Pennsylvania on Friday after an earlier report suggested he wouldn't.
Editor's note: An earlier version of this story, based on an AP report, said Fetterman and Shapiro wouldn't be meeting Biden in Pittsburgh.
Fetterman himself told the Associated Press that there was a scheduling conflict that would prevent him from meeting with the president.
It's since been updated to reflect Fetterman's presence at the speech and his meeting with Biden at the site of the bridge collapse.

—John Fetterman (@JohnFetterman) January 28, 2022
It was not immediately clear why Shapiro was absent from Friday's event.
Sign up for our weekday newsletter, packed with original analysis, news, and trends — delivered right to your inbox.
A Pittsburgh bridge collapsed just hours before Biden's infrastructure-focused event, leaving 10 people injured.
10 people were injured in a bridge collapse just hours before Biden delivered remarks about infrastructure.
Tom Wolf, who is term-limited, and Sen. Bob Casey, who has two more years left, will be in Pittsburgh.
Josh Shapiro, another top Democratic candidate, tweeted that he would join Biden for future events.
Pennsylvania Democrats who won't be on November's ballot were also at Friday's event.

Fetterman met Biden when the president visited the site of the accident.

Fetterman also tweeted local news footage of their meeting.
He then went on to the site of the president's speech.
